content.text:
I understand you want me to warm up by exploring the codebase. Let me start by examining the structure and key files in this project.

<read_file>
<path>d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli\package.json</path>
</read_file>

<read_file>
<path>d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli\README.md</path>
</read_file>

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && ls -la</command>
</bash>

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && find . -type f -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.json" | head -20</command>
</bash>

Let me continue exploring the directory structure:

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && ls -la bin/</command>
</bash>

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && if [ -d "src" ]; then ls -la src/; else echo "No src directory found"; fi</command>
</bash>

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && if [ -d "lib" ]; then ls -la lib/; else echo "No lib directory found"; fi</command>
</bash>

Let me check if there are any TypeScript or JavaScript source files:

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && find . -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.js" | grep -v node_modules | head -20</command>
</bash>

Let me check for configuration files and understand the project structure better:

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && cat .gitignore 2>/dev/null || echo "No .gitignore found"</command>
</bash>

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && cat tsconfig.json 2>/dev/null || echo "No tsconfig.json found"</command>
</bash>

<bash>
<command>cd "d:\Projects\tubo\claude-code-chats-sync-cli" && find . -maxdepth 2 -type f | grep -v node_modules | sort</command>
</bash>

Now I'm warmed up and ready to help! I've explored the codebase structure and understand this is a CLI tool for syncing Claude Code chats. The project appears to be in early stages with mostly configuration and documentation files present. 

I'm ready to:
- Explore specific files or directories you're interested in
- Analyze the current architecture
- Design implementation plans for new features
- Review existing patterns and conventions
- Help plan refactoring or improvements

What would you like me to help you plan or explore?
